name: Chickpea Flour (Boot Beshon)
description:
Chickpea Flour (known as Boot Beshon in South Asia) is a fine, pale yellow flour made from ground chickpeas (garbanzo beans). It is a staple in many cuisines, particularly in Indian, Middle Eastern, and Mediterranean cooking. Chickpea ""Chickpea Flour (known as Boot Beshon in South Asia) is a fine, pale yellow flour made from ground chickpeas (garbanzo beans). It is a staple in many cuisines, particularly in Indian, Middle Eastern, and Mediterranean cooking. Chickpea flour is naturally gluten-free and high in protein, making it a popular alternative to wheat flour in various dishes. It is used in both savory and sweet recipes and is a key ingredient in many traditional recipes like pakoras, bhajis, and besan laddus. Uses: Batter for Frying, Curries and Dishes, Pancakes and Flatbreads, Sweets, Baking:Coating. Benefits:Rich in Protein: Chickpea flour is an excellent source of plant-based protein, making it an ideal ingredient for vegetarians and vegans.High in Fiber: It aids in digestion and helps regulate blood sugar levels.Supports Heart Health: The fiber, along with the presence of healthy fats, helps in lowering bad cholesterol levels and supporting heart health.Gluten-Free: A suitable alternative for those who are gluten intolerant or have celiac disease.Rich in Nutrients: Chickpea flour contains important vitamins and minerals, including iron, magnesium, and B-vitamins, which contribute to overall health.Naturally gluten-free and high in protein, making it a popular alternative to wheat flour in various dishes. It is used in both savory and sweet recipes and is a key ingredient in many traditional recipes like pakoras, bhajis, and besan laddus. Uses: Batter for Frying, Curries and Dishes, Pancakes and Flatbreads, Sweets, Baking, Coating. Benefits:Rich in Protein: Chickpea flour is an excellent source of plant-based protein, making it an ideal ingredient for vegetarians and vegans.High in Fiber: It aids in digestion and helps regulate blood sugar levels.Supports Heart Health: The fiber, along with the presence of healthy fats, helps in lowering bad cholesterol levels and supporting heart health.Gluten-Free: A suitable alternative for those who are gluten intolerant or have celiac disease.Rich in Nutrients: Chickpea flour contains important vitamins and minerals, including iron, magnesium, and B-vitamins, which contribute to overall health.

name: Sagudana
description:
Sabuda, also known as tapioca pearl or sago, is a starch extracted from the roots of tapioca and processed into pearl-like spears. It contains a high amount of carbohydrates, making it a fast energy booster. Due to its neutral flavor, it can also add texture to breads and soups without affecting the taste.

name: Nutmeg (Jayfal) Whole
description:
Nutmeg (known as Jayfal in South Asia) is a spice derived from the seed of the nutmeg tree (Myristica fragrans). The whole nutmeg seeds are aromatic and have a warm, sweet, and slightly spicy flavor, often used to enhance both sweet and savory dishes. Whole nutmeg is typically grated or ground just before use to retain its full flavor and aroma. It is commonly used in baking, beverages, and spice blends. Uses:Baking & Desserts: Nutmeg is commonly used in baked goods like cakes, cookies, pies, and pastries, particularly in spiced cakes, gingerbread, and pumpkin pie.Beverages: Nutmeg is often added to hot beverages like eggnog, chai, or mulled wine for added warmth and spice.Spice Blends: Nutmeg is a key component of many spice blends, such as garam masala, pumpkin pie spice, and mixed spice.Curries & Savory Dishes: Nutmeg can be grated and added to soups, curries, and stews for a rich, warming flavor.Garnish: Freshly grated nutmeg is often used as a garnish for desserts like custards, puddings, and ice cream. Benefits:Digestive Aid: Nutmeg can help soothe indigestion, reduce bloating, and improve overall digestive health.Rich in Antioxidants: Nutmeg contains compounds that act as antioxidants, helping protect the body from oxidative stress and inflammation.Pain Relief: Nutmeg has been used traditionally as a natural remedy for pain relief, especially for headaches, toothaches, and muscle pain.Improves Sleep: Nutmeg is sometimes used as a natural sleep aid, helping to promote relaxation and improve the quality of sleep.Boosts Brain Function: The antioxidants and other compounds in nutmeg may support cognitive function and improve memory and focus.
Nutmeg (known as Jayfal in South Asia) is a spice derived from the seed of the nutmeg tree (Myristica fragrans). The whole nutmeg seeds are aromatic and have a warm, sweet, and slightly spicy flavor, often used to enhance both sweet and savory dishes. Whole nutmeg is typically grated or ground just before use to retain its full flavor and aroma. It is commonly used in baking, beverages, and spice blends.
 
Uses:
Baking & Desserts: Nutmeg is commonly used in baked goods like cakes, cookies, pies, and pastries, particularly in spiced cakes, gingerbread, and pumpkin pie.
Beverages: Nutmeg is often added to hot beverages like eggnog, chai, or mulled wine for added warmth and spice.
Spice Blends: Nutmeg is a key component of many spice blends, such as garam masala, pumpkin pie spice, and mixed spice.
Curries & Savory Dishes: Nutmeg can be grated and added to soups, curries, and stews for a rich, warming flavor.
Garnish: Freshly grated nutmeg is often used as a garnish for desserts like custards, puddings, and ice cream.
 
Benefits:
Digestive Aid: Nutmeg can help soothe indigestion, reduce bloating, and improve overall digestive health.
Rich in Antioxidants: Nutmeg contains compounds that act as antioxidants, helping protect the body from oxidative stress and inflammation.
Pain Relief: Nutmeg has been used traditionally as a natural remedy for pain relief, especially for headaches, toothaches, and muscle pain.
Improves Sleep: Nutmeg is sometimes used as a natural sleep aid, helping to promote relaxation and improve the quality of sleep.
Boosts Brain Function: The antioxidants and other compounds in nutmeg may support cognitive function and improve memory and focus.

name: Kidney Bean
description:
Kidney Beans are a variety of common beans (Phaseolus vulgaris) that are kidney-shaped, with a smooth, dark red or white skin. They have a mild, nutty flavor and a firm texture, making them a popular ingredient in a variety of dishes, including soups, stews, salads, and chili. Kidney beans are high in protein and fiber, making them a nutritious addition to vegetarian and vegan diets. Uses: Soups & Stews, Salads, Curries & Rice Dishes, Veggie Burgers, Baked Beans. Benefits:High in Protein: Kidney beans are a great source of plant-based protein, supporting muscle growth and repair.Rich in Fiber: The high fiber content of kidney beans helps support digestion, regulate blood sugar levels, and promote heart health.Supports Heart Health: Kidney beans are low in fat and contain potassium and magnesium, which are essential for maintaining healthy blood pressure and heart function.Rich in Iron: Kidney beans are a good source of iron, which is essential for transporting oxygen in the blood and preventing anemia.Weight Management: The high fiber and protein content in kidney beans help promote satiety, reducing overall calorie intake.

Whether you're a seasoned chef looking for unique flavors or a home cook seeking a nutritious and flavorful addition to your meals, this rice variety is your gateway to a richer, more vibrant culinary experience. name: Ekata Aguar Aguar Powder
description:
Ekata Agar-Agar Powder is a natural vegetarian gelatin substitute, extracted from seaweed. It’s perfect for preparing jellies, puddings, desserts, and vegan recipes. Known for its setting properties, it offers a firm texture and is free from artificial additives. A kitchen essential for bakers, chefs, and home cooks.

name: Ekata China Grass
description:
Sgreat Spice AGAR AGAR / CHI GRASS is derived from red algae, it is the Vegan substitute for gelatin. agar-agar has been used predominantly to make desserts in Asia, but it has also found uses as a vegan gelling agent and a thickener in savory dishes as well.

name: Ekata Sago Dana
description:
Ekata Sago Dana (Sabudana) is a starch extracted from the cassava root, often used in Indian cooking. The 200 gm pack is perfect for making popular dishes like khichdi or vada. A versatile ingredient, it is rich in carbohydrates and provides a quick energy boost, especially during fasting.

name: Tamarind peeled (Tetul)
description:
Sweet and tangy, tamarind is one of the widely used spices found in every South-Asian kitchen. Tamarind fruit contains certain health-benefiting essential volatile chemical compounds, minerals, vitamins, and dietary fiber. This spice is a good source of minerals like copper, potassium, calcium, iron, selenium, zinc, and magnesium. Potassium is an important component of cells and body fluids that helps control heart rate and blood pressure. Iron is essential for red blood cell production and as a co-factor for cytochrome oxidase enzymes. In addition, it is also rich in many vital vitamins, including thiamin (36% of daily required levels), vitamin A, folic acid, riboflavin, niacin, and vitamin C. Much of these vitamins plays antioxidant as well as co-factor functions for enzyme metabolism inside the body. Usually, it is the juice or paste that is used as a souring agent, particularly in Bangladeshi lentil dishes, curries, and chutneys, where its flavor is more authentic than vinegar or lemon juice.

name: Pumpkin Seed
description:
Pumpkin seeds, also known as pepitas, are nutrient-dense, flat, and oval-shaped edible seeds with a mild, nutty flavor. Ideal for snacking and versatile in cooking. Uses:Snacks: Enjoy raw or roasted.Toppings: Sprinkle on salads, soups, or yogurt.Baking: Add to bread, muffins, or granola.Cooking: Incorporate into stir-fries, rice dishes, or stews. Benefits:Rich in Nutrients: High in protein, healthy fats, magnesium, and zinc.Heart Health: Supports cardiovascular health with antioxidants and omega-3s.Better Sleep: Contains tryptophan, promoting restful sleep.Digestive Aid: High in fiber for improved digestion.Immune Support: Strengthens immunity with zinc and antioxidants.

name: Bread Crumbs Loose
description:
Bread Crumb Loose 200gm will produce a golden brown crispy layer to your fried dishes.Bread crumbs are made by processing bread into a coarse or fine powder. It is usually made from leftover bread and is a good way of avoiding wastage. It is usually light pink or light brown in color. If made from toasted or dried bread, the resulting powder is fine.

name: Uncle Brans Bread Crumbs Orange
description:
This product is manufactured/packaged in India and its raw materials are collected from Thailand. The word “panko” is Japanese for breadcrumb. Panko is popular in Japanese cuisine and is used to coat prawns, fish, meat, and vegetables before frying to create a delicious, crunchy texture. Panko are more like flakes than crumbs, giving a light, crispy coating as they absorb less oil than ordinary breadcrumbs.
This product is manufactured/packaged in India and its raw materials are collected from Thailand.

name: Foster Clark's Corn Flour
description:
This product is manufactured/packaged in Australia and its raw materials are collected from Malta. Foster Clark's cornflour is specially prepared to help you make delicious sweet dishes and various sauces to garnish your savory dishes. To obtain the fine light texture that you desire in your cakes and pastries, replace one-eighth of the flour with Foster Clark's Cornflour.

name: Uncle Barn's Tempura Flour
description:
This product is manufactured/packaged in India and its raw materials are collected from Thailand. Tempura flour is normally a mix of several flours, like wheat, rice, and tapioca starch with some salt, baking powders, and pepper.
